metadata.Title: CVE-2013-1438 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in dcraw 0.8.x through 0.8.9, as used in libraw, ufraw, shotwell, and other products, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted photo file that triggers a (1) divide-by-zero, (2) infinite loop, or (3) NULL pointer dereference.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1438` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

darktable - 2.0.3-1
No subscription required

edisplay - 0.8.9-3build1
exactimage - 0.8.9-3build1
libexactimage-perl - 0.8.9-3build1
python-exactimage - 0.8.9-3build1
No subscription required

libraw-bin - 0.15.3-1ubuntu1
libraw15 - 0.15.3-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

gimp-ufraw - 0.19.2-2ubuntu1
ufraw - 0.19.2-2ubuntu1
ufraw-batch - 0.19.2-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> upstream says to use 0.14-stable branch from github repo sbeattie> darktable as of 2.0.0 does not have embedded LibRaw anymore

criterions.comment: darktable package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.3-1').
dcraw: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
exactimage package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.8.9-3build1').
libraw package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.15.3-1ubuntu1').
rawtherapee: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
ufraw package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.19.2-2ubuntu1').
